subject: Sexual Health
title: Contraception Access Worldwide
description: A micro-lesson that makes Contraception Access Worldwide usable.

hook.text: Over 200 million women worldwide want to prevent pregnancy but lack access to any modern method.

buildup.text: Barriers include cost, distance to clinics, cultural stigma, and laws restricting access.

discovery.text: Unmet contraceptive need is highest in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia where health systems are weakest.

twist.text: Every dollar spent on family planning saves governments three dollars in maternal and child health costs.

climax.text: Closing the access gap would prevent millions of unintended pregnancies and save thousands of lives annually.

punchline.text: Access is the gap between knowledge and reality.

quiz.question: How many women worldwide lack access to modern contraception?
